name: Costa Rica
description: Costa Rica, officially the Republic of Costa Rica, is a tropical country known for its stunning biodiversity, lush rainforests, active volcanoes, and beautiful coastlines. It’s a pioneer in ecotourism and conservation, boasting an impressive 25% of its land protected as national parks and reserves.  With a commitment to sustainability and a welcoming culture, Costa Rica offers a unique blend of adventure, relaxation, and natural beauty.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Spanish is the official language of Costa Rica, though English is widely spoken in tourist areas.
quickFacts.detail: The country's history is deeply intertwined with Spanish colonization, but indigenous languages also hold significance.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: San José is the political, economic, and cultural center of Costa Rica.
quickFacts.detail: It’s a bustling city with a rich history, numerous museums, and vibrant nightlife.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Costa Rica has a relatively small but vibrant population.
quickFacts.detail: The population density is moderate, with most people living in urban areas.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The Costa Rican Colón is the official currency.
quickFacts.detail: The US dollar is also widely accepted.

quickFacts.label: Biodiversity Hotspot
quickFacts.description: Costa Rica is renowned for its incredible biodiversity.
quickFacts.detail: It’s home to over 5% of the world’s biodiversity, including numerous endemic species.

climateData.title: Tropical Climate
climateData.description: Costa Rica experiences a tropical climate with distinct wet and dry seasons. The country’s diverse geography contributes to a wide range of microclimates.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season (December - April)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The dry season is generally sunny and pleasant, with lower humidity and less rainfall. It's ideal for exploring national parks and beaches.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Green Season (May - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The green season brings increased rainfall, lush vegetation, and fewer crowds. It’s a fantastic time for birdwatching and experiencing the rainforest at its most vibrant.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Shoulder Seasons (April-May & November-December)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: These periods offer a balance of good weather and fewer crowds, making them ideal for travel.

naturalWonders.name: Monteverde Cloud Forest
naturalWonders.description: Monteverde is a world-renowned cloud forest, characterized by its persistent mist and incredible biodiversity. It’s a haven for birdwatchers and nature enthusiasts.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Located in the Tilarán Mountains, the cloud forest is home to a vast array of plant and animal life, including the resplendent quetzal. Trails wind through the canopy, offering breathtaking views and opportunities for exploration.

naturalWonders.name: Manuel Antonio National Park
naturalWonders.description: Manuel Antonio is a stunning national park on the Pacific coast, famous for its pristine beaches, lush rainforest, and abundant wildlife.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park offers a diverse range of ecosystems, from sandy beaches to mangrove forests and cloud forests. It’s a popular destination for both wildlife viewing and relaxation.
viewingTips: Hire a guide for wildlife spotting

naturalWonders.name: Arenal Volcano National Park
naturalWonders.description: Arenal Volcano is an iconic landmark in Costa Rica, offering stunning views of the active volcano and surrounding rainforest.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park features hiking trails, hot springs, and opportunities for adventure activities like zip-lining and canyoning. The area is rich in geothermal activity.

ecosystemData.title: Costa Rican Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Costa Rica boasts an incredible array of ecosystems, including rainforests, cloud forests, dry forests, mangroves, and coral reefs. These diverse habitats support a vast array of plant and animal life.

biodiversityCategories.name: Rainforests
biodiversityCategories.description: Costa Rica’s rainforests are incredibly diverse, harboring a vast array of plant and animal species.

statistics.details: Home to an astonishing variety of tree species.
A major center for insect biodiversity.

notableSpecies.name: Resplendent Quetzal
notableSpecies.significance: A symbol of Costa Rica and a prized birdwatcher's target.

notableSpecies.name: Jaguar
notableSpecies.significance: The largest cat in the Americas.

biodiversityCategories.name: Coastal Ecosystems
biodiversityCategories.description: Costa Rica’s coastline is characterized by diverse ecosystems, including coral reefs, mangroves, and sandy beaches.

statistics.details: Provides vital habitat for numerous species.

notableSpecies.name: Green Sea Turtle
notableSpecies.significance: A threatened species that nests on Costa Rican beaches.

notableSpecies.name: Humpback Whale
notableSpecies.significance: Migrates to Costa Rican waters to breed.

activities.title: Costa Rican Adventures
activities.description: Costa Rica offers a wide range of activities for all interests and skill levels, from adrenaline-pumping adventures to relaxing nature experiences.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Costa Rica’s diverse trails, from rainforest hikes to mountain climbs.

activities.name: La Fortuna Waterfall Hike
activities.description: Hike down to the base of the stunning La Fortuna Waterfall and swim in the cool waters.

activities.name: Monteverde Cloud Forest Trails
activities.description: Explore the cloud forest on a network of well-maintained trails.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water activities, from surfing to white-water rafting.

activities.name: Surfing in Tamarindo
activities.description: Learn to surf or improve your skills in the waves of Tamarindo.

activities.name: White-Water Rafting on Pacuare River
activities.description: Experience the thrill of rafting down the pristine Pacuare River.
